title: European Commission President von der Leyen urges EU to prioritize bloc’s economic growth
body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has urged the EU to simplify its regulations on companies operating in the region to boost the bloc’s economic growth. According to the EU chief, the bloc needs to become more competitive against the likes of China and the U.S., where they use “one financial system, one financial capital.” Citing the U.S. as an example of a single federal entity, President Ursula said Europe needs to adopt a handful of other financial centers rather than the 27 individually supervised financial systems within the bloc. She also noted that there are over 300 trading venues across the Union, calling it “fragmentation on steroids.” von der Leyen says the goal of the Savings and Investment Union is to create a single, deep, and liquid capital market. The EU Chief has also said she plans to propose to EU leaders at a March Alden Biesen summit that they endorse a joint single-market roadmap to 2028. Her pledge comes as capitals push for more focus on Europe’s growth in an increasingly uncertain global economy. von der Leyen identifies regulations as barriers to growth in Europe In a closed-door meeting with ambassadors from EU member countries, President von der Leyen discussed barriers to growth in Europe, highlighting burdensome regulations and energy prices as major factors. According to the EU chief, the region should strive to strike a deal among all 27 member states. However, von der Leyen notes that different ways to get around the objections of capitals will be considered to prevent “a lack of progress or ambition” if that proves impossible in vital areas of economic policy. She argues that the only solution is to improve the bloc’s competitiveness to support its drive for independence . “It is clear that we can no longer do business as usual. Diverging national rules and trading conditions across Member States deter businesses from achieving their full potential and limit Europe’s competitiveness. Our primary focus must be to remove these internal barriers.” – Ursula von der Leyen , President of the European Commission Meanwhile, von der Leyen warned in a letter to national leaders on January 9 that the EU is lagging in a world increasingly shaped by raw power, strategic rivalry, and weaponized dependencies. Her concerns come as EU leaders prepare to meet for a working retreat at Aiden Biesen castle in the Belgian countryside on January 12. European Council summons EU leaders, Germany proposes deregulation Last December, European Council President António Costa summoned EU presidents and prime ministers to an informal retreat in rural Belgium scheduled for February 12 this year. Top of the agenda is how to integrate the EU’s single market and leverage the EU’s economic size to ensure the continent is not sidelined. According to Costa, it is essential for the EU to remain calm and serene, and to continue striving to be constructive, especially when dealing with President Donald Trump. However, he added that the relationship between Brussels and Washington is not equal. Costa previously emphasized that his greatest challenge since taking office has been stabilizing the EU-U.S. relationship . The dynamics between the two economic powers are currently different from what they once were, the European Commission president acknowledged. On the other hand, Germany is strongly advocating for slashing regulations if the EU wants a single market. The country has warned the bloc’s leadership that it will only be able to move ahead with merging its national economies if it does not impose additional bureaucratic burdens on industry. Meanwhile, the position paper recently circulated in Berlin, Germany, notes that fixing current barriers to trade within the bloc’s common market will require specific, bold, and in some cases, uncomfortable actions. It will also require countries to accept voluntary national restrictions in the interest of the bloc’s common market. Want your project in front of crypto’s top minds? Feature it in our next industry report, where data meets impact.

title: South Korean Crypto Investors Make Dramatic Pivot to Domestic Stocks Amid Market Shift
body: BitcoinWorld South Korean Crypto Investors Make Dramatic Pivot to Domestic Stocks Amid Market Shift SEOUL, South Korea – March 2025: South Korean retail investors are executing a significant capital migration, abandoning cryptocurrency markets for domestic and international stocks following a prolonged downturn that began in late 2024. This dramatic shift represents one of the most substantial portfolio reallocations in recent Asian financial history, fundamentally altering the investment landscape in one of the world’s most active retail trading nations. South Korean Crypto Investors Drive Unprecedented Market Transition Bloomberg’s comprehensive market analysis reveals a stunning reversal in South Korean investment patterns. Cryptocurrency exchange trading volume, which once surpassed the benchmark KOSPI index, has plummeted approximately 65% year-over-year. Conversely, KOSPI trading volume surged 221% during the same period, according to Financial Supervisory Service data. This divergence highlights a fundamental re-evaluation of risk and opportunity among Korea’s individual investors. The transition follows a cryptocurrency market correction that started in October 2024. Many investors suffered substantial losses after concentrating heavily in volatile alternative coins. Consequently, market fatigue reached unprecedented levels. Now, these same investors are redirecting capital toward more traditional assets. Securities firms report credit balances exceeding 30 trillion won ($22.5 billion), indicating significant available capital for equity investments. Analyzing the KOSPI Trading Volume Surge The KOSPI’s remarkable 221% trading volume increase represents more than simple market rotation. This surge reflects several interconnected factors reshaping South Korea’s financial ecosystem. First, policy initiatives under President Lee Jae-myung’s administration have bolstered market confidence. The government’s explicit pledge to push the KOSPI to 5,000 points has provided clear directional guidance for retail investors. Second, thematic investing has gained tremendous traction. Investors previously attracted to cryptocurrency narratives now pursue artificial intelligence and robotics stocks. Companies like Samsung Electronics, Naver, and Kakao have launched dedicated AI divisions, attracting substantial retail investment. Third, regulatory clarity in traditional markets contrasts with ongoing cryptocurrency uncertainty, making equities more appealing to risk-averse capital. South Korean Market Performance Comparison (2024-2025) Metric Cryptocurrency Markets KOSPI/Stock Markets Trading Volume Change -65% (YoY) +221% (YoY) Retail Participation Declining significantly Reaching record highs Regulatory Environment Uncertain, evolving Stable, supportive Thematic Focus Altcoins, memecoins AI, robotics, semiconductors Expert Analysis of Market Psychology Financial analysts observe that South Korean investors exhibit distinct behavioral patterns. “Korean retail traders historically demonstrate herd mentality and momentum chasing,” explains Dr. Min-ji Park, economics professor at Seoul National University. “The cryptocurrency boom attracted them with promises of rapid gains. However, sustained losses have triggered classic risk aversion. Now, they seek perceived stability in blue-chip stocks with government-backed growth narratives.” This psychological shift has practical implications. Brokerage houses report increased demand for: AI-themed exchange-traded funds (ETFs) Robotics and automation company stocks Semiconductor manufacturers with AI capabilities Financial technology firms integrating blockchain Policy Impacts on Investment Migration President Lee Jae-myung’s economic policies actively encourage stock market participation. The administration’s “KOSPI 5,000” pledge functions as both target and marketing tool. Government initiatives include tax incentives for long-term equity investments and simplified trading procedures. Simultaneously, cryptocurrency regulations remain stringent, with enhanced reporting requirements and trading restrictions. This policy divergence creates powerful incentives. Investors recognize that government support significantly reduces regulatory risk in traditional markets. Furthermore, South Korea’s economic development plans explicitly prioritize technology sectors like AI and robotics. Consequently, investors align their portfolios with national strategic priorities, creating self-reinforcing market trends. Global Context and Comparative Analysis South Korea’s investment shift mirrors broader global trends but exhibits unique characteristics. Unlike Western markets where institutional investors dominate, Korean markets feature exceptionally high retail participation. This amplifies trend movements and creates more volatile transitions. Additionally, Korea’s technological sophistication means investors quickly identify and capitalize on emerging themes like AI. Regional comparisons prove instructive. Japan has seen similar cryptocurrency outflows but toward different destinations, primarily government bonds. China’s capital controls limit comparable movements. Therefore, South Korea represents a distinctive case study in retail-driven market reallocation within an advanced digital economy. Blockchain Technology’s Future Role Despite current cryptocurrency outflows, blockchain technology maintains significant potential. Financial institutions increasingly explore distributed ledger applications for settlement, identity verification, and smart contracts. Bloomberg’s analysis suggests that successful blockchain integration into mainstream finance could reshape markets again. However, this would emphasize utility over speculation. Major Korean banks and securities firms already pilot blockchain projects. These initiatives focus on efficiency improvements rather than cryptocurrency trading. This distinction matters greatly. Future investment might flow toward blockchain infrastructure companies rather than cryptocurrency tokens themselves, representing a more mature market phase. Market Implications and Future Projections The capital migration from cryptocurrencies to stocks carries multiple implications. First, increased equity market participation could enhance market depth and liquidity. Second, reduced cryptocurrency trading may decrease systemic risk from leveraged positions. Third, thematic concentration in AI and robotics could accelerate sector development through increased capital availability. However, risks persist. Herd behavior could create equity bubbles in favored sectors. Additionally, complete cryptocurrency abandonment might cause Korea to miss future digital asset innovations. Market observers recommend balanced approaches, acknowledging both traditional equities’ stability and emerging technologies’ transformative potential. Conclusion South Korean crypto investors have initiated a profound market reallocation, shifting billions from digital assets to domestic and international stocks. This transition reflects multiple factors: cryptocurrency market corrections, supportive government policies, and compelling thematic opportunities in AI and robotics. The KOSPI trading volume surge demonstrates retail capital’s powerful market-moving capability. While current trends favor traditional equities, blockchain technology’s continued evolution suggests future market reshaping. South Korea’s investment landscape remains dynamic, with retail investors serving as both indicators and drivers of financial market evolution. FAQs Q1: What percentage has cryptocurrency trading volume declined in South Korea? Cryptocurrency exchange trading volume has decreased approximately 65% year-over-year according to Bloomberg’s analysis of South Korean market data. Q2: How much has KOSPI trading volume increased during the same period? KOSPI trading volume has surged 221% year-over-year, indicating massive capital rotation from cryptocurrencies to traditional equities. Q3: Which sectors are attracting former cryptocurrency investors? South Korean investors primarily target artificial intelligence and robotics-themed stocks, along with semiconductor manufacturers and technology companies with AI capabilities. Q4: What role does government policy play in this shift? President Lee Jae-myung’s administration has pledged to push the KOSPI to 5,000 points and implemented supportive policies, creating strong incentives for stock market participation. Q5: Could investors return to cryptocurrency markets in the future? Market analysts suggest that if blockchain technology successfully integrates into mainstream financial services, investment could return with a focus on utility rather than speculation. This post South Korean Crypto Investors Make Dramatic Pivot to Domestic Stocks Amid Market Shift first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Solana Gets A Big Infra Signal As Alibaba Demos High-Performance RPCs
body: Solana picked up an infrastructure vote of confidence on Wednesday after Alibaba Cloud used a Hong Kong keynote to demo “high-performance” Solana RPC connectivity, framing the work as part of its broader push to fuse AI tooling with Web3 developer workflows. In a clip shared by Solana’s official X account, the demo came during an Accelerate APAC 2026 keynote titled “Fueling Web3 Innovation with AI on Cloud,” delivered by Zhao Qingyuan of Alibaba Cloud Intelligence Group. The pitch was straightforward: reduce latency and operational overhead for builders who rely on fast, reliable RPC access, especially in trading-heavy use cases where milliseconds can matter. Alibaba Flexes Solana RPC Throughput Zhao framed the talk as a practical example of how large language models can compress development cycles. In the keynote, he said he recently migrated a archive node away from a Google Bigtable setup to an Alibaba Cloud in-house database implementation over a weekend, leaning on AI-assisted coding despite limited prior familiarity with Solana’s usual developer stack. “Just this weekend, I spent two days — I migrated the Solana archive node from a Google Bigtable implementation to Alibaba Cloud’s in-house database implementation,” Zhao said. “I haven’t even learned Rust before, and I just used web coding to do this in two days. And it will download the data from Hugging Face for the historical slots, and it will synchronize the data with the mainnet, and it can provide the RPC service.” The remarks landed alongside Alibaba Cloud’s broader messaging around its Qwen family of models, positioned by the company as a general-purpose LLM stack that can be used for coding, assistants, and multimodal workflows. The more market-relevant part of the demo was the latency claim. Zhao described a setup where users connect to RPC nodes through Alibaba Cloud’s backbone network rather than via general public internet routes. In a table shown during the talk, he said a “get slot” RPC call latency was reduced from roughly 25 milliseconds to about 10 milliseconds under the backbone-network approach, calling it “a huge reduction.” For “get block,” described as a 4MB block payload, he said latency fell from “more than 200 milliseconds” to “less than 200 milliseconds,” while emphasizing stability and suitability for low-latency workloads. JUST IN: Alibaba, the world’s largest ecommerce company, demos high-performance Solana RPCs pic.twitter.com/wwqVLelqUv — Solana (@solana) February 11, 2026 Alibaba Cloud also leaned into geography. Zhao pointed to the firm’s global footprint, highlighting regions such as Frankfurt, the US, and multiple Asia-Pacific hubs including Tokyo, Singapore, and Hong Kong, as a “perfect match” for Solana’s builder base and latency-sensitive applications. While the clip stops short of announcing a formal partnership or a productized Solana RPC offering with pricing or SLAs, the optics are notable: a major cloud provider using a Solana ecosystem stage to publicly benchmark RPC latency improvements, and explicitly tying that to trading and “co-location for the high frequency calls.” At press time, SOL traded at $81.

title: Bybit AZTEC Listing: Strategic Expansion Brings New Trading Opportunities to Crypto Markets
body: BitcoinWorld Bybit AZTEC Listing: Strategic Expansion Brings New Trading Opportunities to Crypto Markets Global cryptocurrency exchange Bybit has announced a significant market expansion, revealing plans to list AZTEC for spot trading beginning February 12, 2025, at precisely 7:00 a.m. UTC, marking another strategic addition to its growing digital asset portfolio. Bybit AZTEC Listing Details and Trading Specifications Bybit confirmed the AZTEC listing through official communications channels on February 10, 2025. The exchange will enable spot trading pairs for AZTEC against major cryptocurrencies including USDT and BTC. Trading will commence following a standard deposit period that begins several hours before the official trading launch. This listing follows Bybit’s established protocol for new asset integrations, which includes thorough technical reviews and liquidity preparations. The exchange has implemented specific trading parameters for AZTEC to ensure market stability. These parameters include minimum order sizes, maximum leverage limits for any future margin products, and standard trading fees consistent with Bybit’s fee structure for similar assets. Market analysts note that Bybit typically experiences increased trading volume during new listing periods, particularly when the asset represents innovative blockchain technology. The technology allows users to transfer digital assets while maintaining transaction privacy through advanced cryptographic methods. Consequently, this approach addresses growing regulatory concerns about transparent blockchain transactions while preserving the fundamental benefits of decentralized networks. The protocol initially launched in 2018 following extensive academic research and cryptographic development. Since then, the AZTEC team has implemented several protocol upgrades to enhance efficiency and reduce transaction costs. Furthermore, the technology has seen increasing adoption within decentralized finance applications that require privacy features for sensitive financial transactions. Major blockchain networks including Ethereum have integrated AZTEC’s privacy technology through standardized implementations. Zero-Knowledge Proof Implementation: Enables transaction validation without revealing sensitive data Ethereum Compatibility: Functions as an Ethereum improvement proposal (EIP) standard Reduced Gas Costs: Optimized cryptographic operations decrease transaction fees Regulatory Compliance Features: Includes optional audit capabilities for regulated entities Market Analysis and Exchange Listing Trends Cryptocurrency exchange listings significantly impact digital asset visibility and liquidity. Industry data from 2024 shows that assets listed on major exchanges typically experience substantial trading volume increases during the first week of availability. Bybit specifically has demonstrated consistent growth in spot trading volume throughout 2024, according to exchange transparency reports. The platform’s user base has expanded across multiple regions, particularly in Asia and Europe where privacy-focused cryptocurrencies have gained notable traction. Exchange selection criteria for new assets have become increasingly rigorous throughout 2024 and into 2025. Bybit’s listing team evaluates multiple factors before approving new trading pairs. These factors include technological innovation, development team credentials, community engagement metrics, and regulatory compliance frameworks. Additionally, the exchange considers market demand signals from its user base through formal request mechanisms and trading pattern analyses. Bybit’s Strategic Expansion in the Competitive Exchange Landscape Bybit continues to expand its spot trading offerings despite increasing regulatory scrutiny across global cryptocurrency markets. The exchange has added approximately 45 new spot trading pairs throughout 2024, focusing on assets with strong technological foundations and active development communities. This expansion strategy aligns with Bybit’s stated goal of providing comprehensive digital asset access while maintaining rigorous security standards and compliance protocols. The competitive landscape for cryptocurrency exchanges has intensified significantly during 2024. Major platforms now compete not only on trading fees and interface design but also on asset diversity and listing velocity. Bybit has positioned itself as an exchange that balances rapid innovation with responsible risk management. The platform’s risk assessment framework includes multi-layered security protocols, real-time market surveillance systems, and comprehensive user protection mechanisms that exceed industry standards. Exchange representatives have emphasized their commitment to supporting blockchain innovation through strategic listings. Bybit’s chief technology officer recently discussed the exchange’s technical evaluation process during a blockchain conference presentation. The presentation detailed how the exchange assesses network security, smart contract audits, and protocol sustainability before approving any new asset listing. These evaluations typically require several weeks of technical analysis and stress testing under simulated market conditions. Privacy Technology Evolution and Regulatory Considerations Privacy-enhancing cryptocurrencies face unique regulatory challenges in global markets. Regulatory agencies have expressed concerns about potential misuse of privacy technologies while acknowledging their legitimate applications for financial privacy. The AZTEC protocol addresses these concerns through its optional transparency features, which allow authorized entities to audit transactions when necessary for compliance purposes. This balanced approach has helped privacy technologies gain acceptance within regulated financial environments. Recent regulatory developments in major jurisdictions have created clearer frameworks for privacy-focused digital assets. The European Union’s Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation (MiCA), implemented in 2024, includes specific provisions for privacy tokens that meet transparency requirements. Similarly, regulatory guidance from financial authorities in Singapore and Switzerland has helped establish compliance standards for privacy-preserving blockchain technologies. These developments have reduced uncertainty for exchanges considering privacy asset listings. Technical Implementation and User Experience Enhancements Bybit has prepared its trading infrastructure to support the AZTEC listing through systematic technical upgrades. The exchange’s engineering team completed wallet integration testing during January 2025, ensuring seamless deposit and withdrawal functionality. Additionally, the team optimized matching engine performance to handle expected trading volume increases during the initial listing period. These preparations follow Bybit’s established deployment protocols for new asset integrations. User interface enhancements accompany the AZTEC listing to improve trading experience. The exchange updated its trading view to include AZTEC-specific market data visualization and advanced order types. Educational resources about privacy technologies are also available through Bybit’s learning platform. These resources help users understand the technical foundations and practical applications of privacy-preserving blockchain protocols before engaging in trading activities. Wallet Security: Multi-signature cold storage implementation for AZTEC assets Market Data: Real-time price feeds from multiple liquidity sources Educational Content: Technical explainers and trading strategy guides Risk Management Tools: Enhanced volatility protection for new listings Conclusion The Bybit AZTEC listing represents a significant development in cryptocurrency market accessibility for privacy-focused blockchain technologies. This strategic addition to Bybit’s trading portfolio demonstrates the exchange’s commitment to supporting innovative digital assets while maintaining rigorous compliance standards. The listing provides traders with expanded opportunities in the evolving cryptocurrency landscape, particularly as privacy technologies gain broader acceptance within regulated financial ecosystems. Market participants will closely monitor trading activity following the February 12 launch as indicators of broader adoption trends for privacy-enhancing digital assets. FAQs Q1: What time exactly does AZTEC trading begin on Bybit? title: Fugitive gets 20 years for $73M crypto fraud scheme
body: A US federal court sentenced Daren Li to 20 years in prison for his role in a $73 million cryptocurrency scam. Li, 42, is a dual citizen of China and St. Kitts and Nevis who fled after cutting his ankle monitor in December 2025.

title: CBA Stock Soars 8.4%, Biggest Gain Since 2020 on Strong Earnings
body: The largest retail bank in Australia just saw its stock surge after reporting its earnings for the half year ending in December 31, 2025. Record Gain Since March 2020 The Commonwealth Bank of Australia’s (CBA) share jumped by as much as 8.4% on Wednesday, marking the blue chip company’s highest intra-day gain since late March 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic. CBA’s price shot up after the lender released its latest financial results. The bank reported that from June to December 2025, its statutory net profit after tax surged to $5.41 billion from $5.14 billion during the same period in 2024. Its cash net profit after tax also increased to $5.45 billion from last year’s $5.13 billion. The bank’s assets under management (AUM) likewise rose from $20.28 billion to $22.3 billion. “Our balance sheet settings remain resilient with strong levels of capital, deposit funding and provisioning given the economic backdrop and geopolitical issues,” said CBA CEO Matt Comyn. “Our financial position enables us to support lending growth, continue investing to accelerate our technology modernisation agenda and enhance our GenAI capability, and help combat fraud, scams, cyber threats and financial crime.” Market Competitive Edge Reuters reports that home loans, business loans and deposits underpin the Big Four bank’s earnings. CBA’s home lending volume rose by 3.7% while business lending volume grew by 6%. Household deposits also increased by 7.5% enabling the bank to retain 25.4% shares in the home lending market. “The main highlight from this result from CBA has been the growth in the business bank and operational excellence across mortgages in a higher competition environment,” said investment analyst Michael Haynes, from Atlas Funds Management, which owns CBA shares. Interim Dividend for Shareholders CBA declared a fully-franked interim dividend of $2.35 per share following its strong half-year performance. This will be paid to shareholders as of February 19 on March 30. Last year, the bank distributed $2.25 per share.

title: Aviva’s Transformative Leap: UK Insurer Partners with Ripple to Revolutionize Fund Tokenization on XRP Ledger
body: BitcoinWorld Aviva’s Transformative Leap: UK Insurer Partners with Ripple to Revolutionize Fund Tokenization on XRP Ledger In a landmark development for both traditional finance and blockchain technology, Aviva Investors announced on March 15, 2025, a strategic partnership with Ripple to tokenize traditional investment funds on the XRP Ledger. This collaboration represents one of the most significant moves by a major UK insurer into the digital asset space, potentially reshaping how institutional investors manage and distribute fund products. Aviva’s Strategic Move into Tokenized Funds Aviva Investors, the asset management division of the 325-year-old British insurance giant Aviva, has revealed plans to digitize traditional fund structures using blockchain technology. Consequently, this initiative marks a substantial shift in how established financial institutions approach asset management. Moreover, Ripple will provide comprehensive support for issuing and managing these tokenized funds on the XRP Ledger (XRPL). The partnership emerges during a period of increasing institutional adoption of blockchain solutions. Specifically, traditional finance entities seek operational efficiencies and enhanced liquidity. According to recent data from the Bank for International Settlements, tokenization of real-world assets could represent a $16 trillion market opportunity by 2030. Therefore, Aviva’s move positions the insurer at the forefront of this financial transformation. Understanding the XRP Ledger Infrastructure The XRP Ledger provides the foundational technology for this ambitious project. Significantly, XRPL operates as a decentralized, open-source blockchain that has processed over 2.8 billion transactions since its inception. Furthermore, the ledger offers several features particularly suited to financial applications: Speed and Efficiency: Transactions typically settle in 3-5 seconds with minimal energy consumption Built-in Tokenization: Native support for issuing and managing digital assets through the XLS-20 standard Regulatory Compliance: Features that enable compliance with financial regulations across jurisdictions Established Network: Over 120 validators maintain network security and decentralization Ripple’s involvement extends beyond mere technical support. The company brings extensive experience in bridging traditional finance with blockchain solutions, having previously worked with numerous central banks and financial institutions on cross-border payment systems. The Technical Implementation Process Tokenization involves converting rights to a real-world asset into a digital token on a blockchain. For Aviva’s funds, this process will follow a structured approach. Initially, fund units will be represented as digital tokens on XRPL. Subsequently, these tokens will enable fractional ownership, potentially lowering investment minimums. Additionally, blockchain’s inherent transparency will provide real-time audit trails for all transactions. The implementation will leverage XRPL’s decentralized exchange functionality. This feature allows for peer-to-peer trading of tokenized assets without intermediaries. Importantly, this could reduce settlement times from days to seconds while lowering associated costs. According to a 2024 report by Deloitte, blockchain implementation in asset management can reduce operational costs by 30-50%. Market Context and Industry Implications Aviva’s announcement occurs within a broader trend of institutional blockchain adoption. Major financial players have increasingly explored tokenization in recent years. For instance, BlackRock launched its first tokenized fund in 2023. Similarly, JPMorgan has conducted extensive experiments with blockchain-based settlement systems. However, Aviva represents one of the first major insurers to commit publicly to full-scale tokenization of traditional funds. The insurance sector particularly stands to benefit from blockchain integration. Specifically, tokenization could streamline complex processes in several areas: Insurance Application Potential Blockchain Benefit Investment Portfolio Management Real-time valuation and automated compliance Policy-linked Investments Transparent tracking of underlying assets Reinsurance Contracts Automated settlement and reduced counterparty risk Capital Requirements Improved liquidity management and regulatory reporting Industry experts have noted the strategic importance of this development. Dr. Sarah Chen, a financial technology researcher at Cambridge University, explains, “Aviva’s move signals that tokenization has moved beyond experimental phases. Established institutions now view blockchain as essential infrastructure rather than speculative technology.” Regulatory Landscape and Compliance Considerations The UK’s regulatory environment has evolved to accommodate blockchain innovation while maintaining investor protections. The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) has established a regulatory sandbox for testing blockchain applications since 2016. Moreover, the UK government’s 2024 Financial Services and Markets Act explicitly recognizes digital assets within the regulatory framework. Aviva’s tokenized funds will need to comply with existing financial regulations. These include MiFID II transparency requirements, anti-money laundering directives, and consumer protection standards. Fortunately, XRPL’s design incorporates features that facilitate regulatory compliance. For example, the ledger supports account freezing and asset seizure capabilities when required by legal authorities. The partnership also considers cross-border regulatory challenges. Since Aviva operates in multiple jurisdictions, the tokenized funds must navigate varying regulatory approaches. Ripple’s experience with international financial systems provides valuable expertise in this complex area. Notably, the company has previously worked with regulatory bodies in over 40 countries. Timeline and Implementation Phases The collaboration will proceed through carefully planned stages. Initially, the partners will conduct technical testing and regulatory consultations throughout 2025. Subsequently, a pilot program for select institutional clients will launch in early 2026. Finally, full-scale implementation across Aviva’s fund offerings will follow regulatory approval. This phased approach mirrors best practices in financial technology adoption. It allows for thorough testing while gradually building institutional and investor confidence. Additionally, it provides time to address any technical or regulatory challenges that may emerge during implementation. Potential Impacts on Investors and Markets Tokenization could fundamentally change how investors interact with traditional funds. Retail investors might access previously exclusive investment opportunities through fractional ownership. Institutional investors could benefit from improved liquidity and settlement efficiency. Furthermore, all investors would gain enhanced transparency regarding fund composition and performance. The broader market implications extend beyond Aviva’s specific funds. Successful implementation could accelerate adoption across the insurance and asset management sectors. This might lead to increased standardization of tokenization protocols. Consequently, interoperability between different blockchain systems would become increasingly important. Market infrastructure would also need to evolve. Custody solutions, valuation methodologies, and trading venues must adapt to accommodate tokenized assets. Traditional financial intermediaries face both disruption and opportunity in this changing landscape. Some may develop new services around blockchain-based assets while others might face disintermediation. Conclusion Aviva’s partnership with Ripple to tokenize traditional funds on the XRP Ledger represents a significant milestone in financial innovation. This collaboration bridges centuries-old insurance traditions with cutting-edge blockchain technology. The move demonstrates growing institutional confidence in blockchain’s potential to transform asset management. Moreover, it highlights the XRP Ledger’s capabilities as infrastructure for regulated financial applications. As implementation progresses, the financial industry will closely watch this pioneering initiative. Ultimately, Aviva’s tokenized funds could establish new standards for efficiency, transparency, and accessibility in investment products. FAQs Q1: What does tokenization mean for traditional investment funds? Tokenization converts fund units into digital tokens on a blockchain. This enables fractional ownership, faster settlement, enhanced transparency, and potentially lower costs for both fund managers and investors. Q2: Why did Aviva choose the XRP Ledger for this project? Aviva selected XRPL for its proven transaction speed, energy efficiency, built-in tokenization capabilities, and regulatory compliance features. The ledger’s established network and Ripple’s institutional experience also contributed to this decision. Q3: How will tokenization affect existing Aviva fund investors? Existing investors will experience a transition to tokenized units. This should provide benefits including improved liquidity options, enhanced transparency, and potentially lower fees. The fundamental investment strategy and underlying assets will remain unchanged initially. Q4: What regulatory approvals are required for tokenized funds? The tokenized funds must comply with UK financial regulations including FCA oversight. They must meet MiFID II requirements, anti-money laundering rules, and consumer protection standards. Cross-border operations will require compliance with regulations in each jurisdiction. Q5: When will Aviva’s tokenized funds become available to investors? The implementation follows a phased approach. Technical testing and regulatory consultations continue through 2025. A pilot program for select clients launches in early 2026, with broader availability following successful testing and regulatory approval. This post Aviva’s Transformative Leap: UK Insurer Partners with Ripple to Revolutionize Fund Tokenization on XRP Ledger first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Bitcoin: Fundamental And Quantitative Analysis, Long-Term Potential Is Present
body: Summary Bitcoin is rated 'Strong Buy' due to robust network value, user growth, and an attractive current entry point. Quantitative models forecast BTC trading at $182,892–$215,000 by early 2027, with current prices below even the lowest model estimate of year-end price. BTC’s correlation with equities has increased post-ETF approval, but its risk profile and diversifying benefits remain compelling. Key risks include potential institutional centralization, proxy challenges from ETF adoption, and existential threats like cryptographic advances. Key Findings As it will be discussed in the article, Bitcoin’s (BTC-USD) value is mostly based on its network value and user growth in the long term. Although in recent years, there have been signs that Bitcoin is affected by systematic risk factors just like the overall equity market, its risk is still mostly unique and thus adds great diversifying value to a portfolio. In addition, the results of the various quantitative price forecasting tools show that Bitcoin stands to offer substantial gains to its investors. Recent Developments Since its peak of ~$125 thousand on October 7 th , Bitcoin’s price has dropped by more than 45% as of February 10 th . It can be argued that it was caused by overall shaky market dynamics, overextension of the previous rally, the discovery of Epstein’s ties to Bitcoin , and overall negative risk sentiment around the asset. On February 6 th, it had seen a low of $60 thousand, and as of February 10 th, it had slightly recovered to ~$68 thousand. Quantitative Models Metcalfe Network Value Metcalfe’s law has been used to value telecommunication networks in the past, and many, together with the CFA Institute, have proposed it as a method to value Bitcoin . Metcalfe’s law uses “users” or “participants” in the network as a base of the model. As there is no single number that represents the exact number of users of Bitcoin, I have decided to use the Active Addresses data from Glassdoor, spanning from 2010 all the way to January 2026. Author, using data from Glassnode as of February 10th As can be seen in the above chart that shows the log-log relationship between the Metcalfe model value and Bitcoin’s price, there is a strong positive relationship. The regression model results in an r^2 of 0.86 (correlation of ~0.92), with a coefficient of 0.9211 and a constant intercept of -15.72, with t-stats well over 100 each. Normally, the process stops here, but for a more comprehensive valuation and forecasting, I have taken the process several steps ahead. Author, using data from Glassnode as of February 10th The chart above shows the log-log relationship between time (days) and active wallets. Again, it can be seen that the relationship is very strong, with an r^2 of 0.917 (correlation of ~0.95), a coefficient of 1.71 (t-stat of 250), and a constant intercept of -0.5461 (t-stat of -10.368). This effect, called the Power Law Adoption path, will also be the theoretical foundation for the power law pricing model, which is simpler and yet very powerful, that we will discuss later. As the user base is now easily forecastable in the future, and Metcalfe’s law is based upon it, Bitcoin’s price can be forecasted. First, some adjustments must be made. Author, using data from Glassnode as of February 10th Although above I had discussed that Metcalfe’s network value and Bitcoin price were heavily correlated, it can be seen that the base model with only one coefficient breaks over time. This can be attributed to Bitcoin’s overall adoption as a reserve asset by firms such as MicroStrategy (Strategy) (MSTR), Tesla (TSLA), and even the country of El Salvador, started purchasing . In addition, on January 10 th of 2024, the SEC approved spot Bitcoin ETFs , which resulted in large-scale institutional purchases. These two events changed how Bitcoin acts and thus how the model should value it. I have added two dummy variables, one in 2020 and one in 2024, to change the slope in these two years to more accurately reflect the real value of the network. As it is present in many financial assets, in this model, autocorrelation is present. Basically, positive forecast errors tend to remain positive for some time and vice versa. In the charts below, the autocorrelation and partial autocorrelation figures can be seen showing the severe and strong autocorrelation that is present. As most of it is from the 1 st lag (correlation of 0.9571), an AR(1) process is an adequate addition to the model. Author, using data from Glassnode as of February 10th In the above chart, the model’s forecast (model anchor, the green line) and the actual price can be observed. Although the price and predicted value diverge from time to time, they follow the overall trend and converge from time to time, which is exactly how a similar model is expected to act. Author, using data from Glassnode as of February 10th Based on the user forecasting methodology discussed above and the model constructed step by step, these are the results. The thick red line that can be seen is the expected path of Bitcoin according to the model, and the red bands represent a 99.9% statistical confidence interval. The predicted price for January 1 st, 2027, is $182,892, with the range being $99,238-339,961, and $274,369 with the range of $148,247-512,184 for January 1 st, 2028. The ranges are quite ample due to the volatility of Bitcoin and the choice of a large confidence interval, but it is quite helpful at giving an overall idea of the future to position ourselves in. Power Law Bitbo Based on a similar theoretical basis of the idea that Bitcoin users grow logarithmically, the famous and widely used Power Law is a simple log-log regression of time on Bitcoin’s price. ( More information can be found on Bitbo ). According to this model, on December 31 st, 2026, Bitcoin is expected to trade at $199,379, with a range of $70,742-683,258, and $273,432, with a range of $97,017-896,620 on December 31, 2027. This model has even larger ranges, but it is still very powerful and elegant through its simplicity and gives a good idea of the future probable outcomes. Stock to Income Bitbo I prefer the stock-to-income model to the classic and well-known stock-to-flow due to its incorporation of mining costs and sale pressures. Both models incorporate the halving cycles very well and are inspired by models used in commodities such as gold. ( More information can be found on Bitbo ). According to this model, on January 1, 2027, Bitcoin is expected to trade at $215 thousand with a range of $109-430 thousand and $409 thousand with a range of $204-817 thousand on January 1, 2028. This model has a slightly tighter range, but Bitcoin has had a history of trading slightly below and very much above the range. Model Results According to all three models, Bitcoin is expected to trade at substantially higher prices, and in all three models, the current price of ~$68 thousand is below the lowest price range for the year-end estimates. Thus, according to the models, the current price is an attractive entry for Bitcoin. Macro Variables Fed Net Liquidity Author, using data from Glassnode & FRED as of February 10th Author, using data from Glassnode & FRED as of February 10th One of the macro variables most followed by Bitcoin investors recently has been the Fed's net liquidity, but the numbers show us that it shouldn’t be the case. The two have a slight positive relationship, which is not statistically significant, with an r^2 of 0.003 (correlation of ~0.05) and a beta coefficient of 0.42 with a t-stat of 1.655 (p-value of 0.098). Although an argument would be that the effect would be lagged due to the monetary transmission mechanism, even with lags, a relevant statistical inference cannot be made. Here are the lags with the highest statistical significance: Lag (Weeks) Correlation T-Stat P-Value Coefficient 57 -0.0883 -2.4243 0.0156 -0.5459 61 -0.0808 -2.2112 0.0273 -0.4907 3 0.0732 2.0788 0.0380 0.5298 It can be seen that none of them are highly significant, and the one with the highest significance even has a negative coefficient. Thus, further analysis of this variable has no real value. 10-Year Treasury Bond Yields Author, using data from Glassnode and FRED as of February 10th Author, using data from Glassnode and FRED as of February 10th Surprisingly enough, the situation is almost the same for the treasury yields, too. The relationship between the yields and price is just slightly negative, with an r^2 that is virtually zero and a coefficient of -0.0012 with a t-stat of -0.16 (p-value of 0.988), which shows that the relationship is practically nonexistent. But the lag analysis has resulted in an interesting finding. Lag (Weeks) Correlation T-Stat P-Value Coefficient 80 -0.1719 -4.6993 0.0000 -0.3054 82 -0.0837 -2.2591 0.0242 -0.1478 45 -0.0801 -2.2142 0.0271 -0.1579 The most significant and substantial lag in the finding is the 80-week lag, with a coefficient of -0.3054. Meaning that a one percent change in the yield (not a percentage point increase in the yield itself) in the yield would lead to a 0.35% decrease in the price of Bitcoin 80 weeks later. Although the correlation of -0.1719 isn’t huge, it's still quite significant. 80 weeks ago, on July 29 th, 2024, the US 10-year bonds traded at a yield of 3.794%, compared to the current 4.16%. This would correlate to an overall negative movement in Bitcoin. But the reality is that this relationship doesn't seem theoretically sensible, as although the monetary transmission mechanism is slow, it shouldn't be this slow. In any case, it's better to keep it in mind as a peculiarity that may be real but is suspect. S&P 500 Author, using data from Glassnode and FRED as of February 10th Bitcoin and the S&P 500 have a positive relationship, with an r^2 of 0.067 (correlation of ~0.25) and a beta coefficient of 0.95 with a t-stat of 13.620 (p-value ~0). Although the relationship isn’t that strong, it's way stronger than any of the other macro variables analyzed above, it's statistically significant, and the effects can also be quite substantial due to the coefficient value and the volatility of the equity market. There isn’t any substantial result from the lag analysis; thus, I have decided to omit it. Author, using data from Glassnode and FRED as of February 10th The most interesting aspect of the relationship is that it’s getting stronger through time, as can be seen in the above 4-week rolling correlation over time. Although the dates are not very visible on the chart itself, the correlation peaks tend to occur during market drops. This is a phenomenon that can be seen in many markets, where correlations tend to approach 1 in times of market distress. Thus, this brings us to the next variable, which will help us better understand this relationship. Market Implied Volatility ( VIX ) Author, using data from Glassnode and FRED as of February 10th Author, using data from Glassnode and FRED as of February 10th The regression has an r^2 of 0.016 (correlation of ~0.126), a beta coefficient of -0.0896 with a t-stat of -8.07 (p-value ~0). Although the relationship isn’t as strong as the one with the S&P 500, it gives us some important information. As can be seen, the correlation between Bitcoin and VIX has been decreasing over time, pointing towards a stronger negative relationship, which is the inverse of what we see with the S&P 500, but in both cases, the meaning is that the relationship is getting stronger. What we can understand from here is that the same risks that affect the S&P 500, such as future uncertainty, geopolitical risks, and so on, have a similar effect on Bitcoin. Now, this is a lot more different than Gold, which has a well-known role of increasing in price in times of distress. This is a well-known phenomenon already, but the overall picture is that Bitcoin has a different risk structure than Gold. Although the same risks that affect the S&P 500 do affect Bitcoin, it must be remembered that the r^2 is just 0.016 with VIX and 0.067 with the S&P 500, meaning that the unexplained variance percentage is still 98.4% and 93.3%, respectively. Thus, pointing us towards reality has historically been a great diversifier. Author, using data from Glassnode as of February 10th Author, using data from Glassnode as of February 10th While the institutional acceptance of Bitcoin seems to have increased its correlation with the equity markets, it also seems to have decreased its risk. As can be seen in the chart above, the rolling 30-day standard deviation has decreased over time. Standard financial theory tells us that this should also lead to lower returns, which is also what we observe in the figure below of the former one. Although in the long term a lower risk, lower return structure will probably occur, in the medium term, like the next 2-3 years, the attractive low correlation structure and still ample potential of adoption growth can be expected to bring in much more capital. Thus, also with the quantitative models in mind, Bitcoin is an attractive asset to buy right now. Risks Although quite improbable, if the ties between Epstein and Bitcoin turn out to be way deeper, and if the “conspiracy” that some have thrown out that he may be Satoshi himself does indeed come out to be true, it could be catastrophic for Bitcoin. There are also several more conspiracies about Satoshi being the CIA or the NSA, but again, they’re conspiracies. Although the model based on Metcalfe’s law and the power law model are based on the logarithmic growth of users, it's getting harder and harder to find a proxy for it. This is due to ETFs and third-party custody becoming increasingly more common. The current number of active addresses (~640 thousand) is way below its peak in April 2021 of 1.35 million. Although it's not too big a problem right now, this may lead to the valuation of Bitcoin getting harder. Bitcoin may struggle to “compete” against other cryptocurrencies, as many of them have more uses, and thus could result in Bitcoin not being the preferred store of value. Although this seems quite improbable due to the legacy of Bitcoin. Finally, the biggest risk of Bitcoin could result from its institutional adoption. As more and more institutions hold Bitcoin and even acquire the mining facilities and thus the voting rights of the network, Bitcoin may lose its decentralized nature. There is the risk that the supply of Bitcoin could technically be increased, or a fork of Bitcoin could be created that becomes the institutional favorite, which has a more easily manipulable supply. Again, due to institutional adoption, most prominently the financialization of Bitcoin, where ETF shares, futures contracts, swaps, and loans create many claims on the same Bitcoin, thus synthetically increasing its supply. This may lead to increased volatility in times of market distress, flash crashes, and even loss of faith in the mission of Bitcoin. Additionally, there is the risk that quantum computers or AI may be able to crack Bitcoin’s cryptography. Although it's not well understood how that may be the case, and if that is actually doable, how it would even work, and if something can be done about it, it is a real risk that should be kept in mind. Finally, any sale from Satoshi’s wallet may lead to market distress. Concluding Remarks Bitcoin has been one of the most interesting developments in the 21st century due to its enigmatic nature and its hard-to-understand nature. But to many people who live in tyrannical countries, Bitcoin has been a door to freedom. Apart from that, its acceptance from institutions and even governments has put Bitcoin on the track to becoming one of the reserve assets of the financial world. In this article, several valuation methodologies have been proposed and used to forecast its future performance, and several macro variables have been used to show how Bitcoin even acts and to understand its standing in the financial world. The conclusion is that Bitcoin offers a great return opportunity while also acting as a diversifying asset in a diversified portfolio. And for these reasons, I rate Bitcoin as a “Strong Buy.”

title: Bitcoin falls to $66,000 as silver clears $85 and dollar extend declines
body: Bitcoin just dropped to $66,000, extending its two-day slide from $68K as bulls fail to find any support. Silver is ripping, now up 6.6% to $85.98, completely erasing yesterday’s 3% dump. Gold hit $5,111.30, climbing 1.8%, while the dollar slumped to a 2-week low ahead of U.S. jobs data later today.
